sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
An answer to George Keith's libel. Against a catechism published by Francis Makemie. : To which is added, by way of postscript. A brief narrative of a late difference among the Quakers, begun at Philadelphia. Makemie, Francis, 1658-1708. Keith, George, 1639?-1716. Mather, Increase, 1639-1723.
[12], 103, [1] p.
Printed, by Benjamin Harris, at the sign of the Bible, over-against the Blew-Anchor, Boston, : MDCXCIIII. [i.e. 1694]
"An epistle to the reader" dated and signed: At Rehoboth in Pocamok Maryland. This 26 July, 1692. Francis Makemie. "Imprimatur, Increase Mather March 31st, 1694"--T.p. verso. "Christian reader" (p. [3-5], 1st grouping) signed: Increase Mather, James Allen, Samuel Baily, Cotton Mather. "A true copy of George Keith's paper ...": p. 5-19. Imperfect: tightly bound, stained, and cropped with some loss of print. Reproduction of original in the John Carter Brown Library.
=======
An answer to George Keith's libel. Against a catechism published by Francis Makemie. : To which is added, by way of postscript. A brief narrative of a late difference among the Quakers, begun at Philadelphia. Makemie, Francis, 1658-1708. Keith, George, 1639?-1716. Mather, Increase, 1639-1723.
[12], 103, [1] p.
Printed, by Benjamin Harris, at the sign of the Bible, over-against the Blew-Anchor, Boston, : MDCXCIIII. [i.e. 1694]
"An epistle to the reader" dated and signed: At Rehoboth in Pocamok Maryland. This 26 July, 1692. Francis Makemie. "Imprimatur, Increase Mather March 31st, 1694"--T.p. verso. "Christian reader" (p. [3-5], 1st grouping) signed: Increase Mather, James Allen, Samuel Baily, Cotton Mather. "A true copy of George Keith's paper ...": p. 5-19. Imperfect: tightly bound, stained, and cropped with some loss of print. Reproduction of original in the John Carter Brown Library.
Benjamin Harris
the sign of the Bible, over-against the Blew-Anchor
